entries.name: SLAICEPS
entries.desc: Characters which are substituted in written strings

entries.name: SPECIALS
entries.desc: The order in which the substitutions occur

entries.name: raw
entries.desc: If raw is true, then REXML leaves the value alone

entries.name: new(arg, respect_whitespace=false, parent=nil, raw=nil, entity_filter=nil, illegal=NEEDS_A_SECOND_CHECK )
entries.desc: Constructor arg if a String, the content is set to the String. If a Text, the object is shallowly cloned.

entries.name: <<( to_append )
entries.desc: Appends text to this text node.  The text is appended in the raw mode of this text node.

entries.name: <=>( other )
entries.desc: other a String or a Text returns the result of (to_s <=> arg.to_s)

entries.name: to_s()
entries.desc: Returns the string value of this text node.  This string is always escaped, meaning that it is a valid XML text node string, and all entities that can be escaped, have been inserted.  This method respects the entity filter set in the constructor.

entries.name: value()
entries.desc: Returns the string value of this text.  This is the text without entities, as it might be used programmatically, or printed to the console.  This ignores the 'raw' attribute setting, and any entity_filter.

entries.name: value=( val )
entries.desc: Sets the contents of this text node.  This expects the text to be unnormalized.  It returns self.

entries.name: write_with_substitution(out, input)
entries.desc: Writes out text, substituting special characters beforehand. out A String, IO, or any other object supporting <<( String ) input the text to substitute and the write out

entries.name: xpath()
entries.desc: FIXME This probably won't work properly
